annotations.description: An example ReactJS application hosted in an nginx container

message:

annotations.description: Exposes and load balances the front end pods
Defines how to deploy the application server

parameters.name: NAME
parameters.description: The name assigned to all of the frontend objects defined in this template.

parameters.name: APP_IMAGE_NAMESPACE
parameters.description: The OpenShift Namespace where the ImageStream resides.

parameters.name: MEMORY_LIMIT
parameters.description: Maximum amount of memory the Django container can use.

parameters.name: VOLUME_CAPACITY
parameters.description: Volume space available for data, e.g. 512Mi, 2Gi

parameters.name: SOURCE_REPOSITORY_URL
parameters.description: The URL of the repository with your application source code.

parameters.name: SOURCE_REPOSITORY_REF
parameters.description: Set this to a branch name, tag or other ref of your repository if you are not using the default branch.

parameters.name: CONTEXT_DIR
parameters.description: Set this to the relative path to your project if it is not in the root of your repository.

parameters.name: APPLICATION_DOMAIN
parameters.description: The exposed hostname that will route to the Django service, if left blank a value will be defaulted.

parameters.name: GITHUB_WEBHOOK_SECRET
parameters.description: A secret string used to configure the GitHub webhook.

parameters.name: APP_DEPLOYMENT_TAG
parameters.displayName: Image tag to watch for changes and trigger deployment.
parameters.description: Image tag to watch for changes and trigger deployment.
